ygData.subject: SV: Re: Skill Cap
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi To all the new ppl who dosent seam to think there is a skill cap and alsp who has it all wront. The skill is caped Lv x 5 + 5 starting at lv 16, so lets
ygData.messageBody:
Hi


To all the new ppl who dosent seam to think there is a skill cap and alsp who has it all wront.
The skill is caped Lv x 5 + 5 starting at lv 16, so lets make an example.

Lv 32 Gnome wizard will be like this 32-16=16x5=80+5=85

ANd nothing else, i put in over 2 k on the skill and talked withe the head GM on Veeshan who tried it out with his char. Itï¿½s the same level cap as for research.


Askur Lv 32 Wizard of Veeshan with an Tinkering skill at 95 (Magicaly enhanced by the GM for all the cash i put in and didnt get any points in it)

----- Original Message -----
From: Wopr <inewton@...>
To: <EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, December 14, 1999 4:35 PM
Subject: [EQ_Tinkering] Re: Skill Cap


> From: "Wopr" <inewton@...>
>
> Last night I did my first tinkering of my gnomish career. I spent about
> 60pp after selling back everything I made and raised my skill from 50 to 58.
>
> If the skill cap is indeed (lvl * 5) - 13 (thanks Diabloklr) I have quite a
> way to go before my lvl 18 gnome wiz hits 77. Time to make some moola!!
>
> One thing I did learn last night. Tinkering rocks! I love it. I have
> never had so much fun with a trade skill. There are all kinds of things to
> make.
>
> Also, last night people asked to buy a spyglass, cams, and a compass from me
> when they heard I was trying to tinker. So there is a market for some of
> this stuff even though the market may be small.
>
> Wopr <Valiant Souls>
> gnome wizard
> Bertoxxulous
>
>
